intro: Psilocarphus caulescens, commonly known as the slender-stemmed psilocarphus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. While not psychoactive like some other members of the Psilocybe genus, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
